page.title: 04PLAYGROUND GAMES,BARNSTAPLE.
page.content: The sort of{games}we play in the playground in the 1980's are often basically similar.Forty forty is like Hide and Seek.French skipping is like Jinx;Turkey,Mother May I,Grand Mother's Footsteps and My Red Letter are all similar.Off ground Tick,Budge and Sticky Glue are roughly the same. Redrovers, Bulldog, Polo, Steps, Egg- Bacon-Cheese or Flan, and S-T-O-P are alike also.{THE RULES TO PLAY: {Budge}is for two players or over. You need 3 items in the playground which can be "safe" areas. There is one person who's "it",she counts to ten while the other players run away. She chases one of the players to a "safe" area in the playground.If the player gets there,the chaser will then chase somebody else.If another player goes to a"safe" area which is not free the person shouts{budge}and has to run on.
